United States, Virginia
Company: Peraton

Overview

Overview
Peraton is seeking a motivated, customer oriented Senior IdAM DevOps Engineer to support our high-profile government client.

Responsibilities

What you’ll do…

  • Independently develop software or systems engineering supporting Cyber focused development. Tasks may include Graphical User Interfaces (GUI’s), middleware, data transformations, statistical and big data analysis.
  • Provide expertise in multiple programming languages to include Java, Django, Python, Drupal, or other high level language development or database management.

The company has experienced consistent growth since it's inception and wants to add more skillsets to their expanding Cloud infrastructure. You will be responsible for being both an individual contributor as well as having the opportunity to lead an internal team of engineers through the company's growing needs. Besides a fully remote advantage, this position offers amazing work/life balance, full benefits, PTO, and flexibility within your day-to-day responsibilities. Apply now as interviews are already underway. Needed: CI/CD automation experience Strong AWS and Cloud Management experience Infrastructure as Code Necessary key skills: DevOps AWS Ruby / Python / Javascript Docker / Kubernetes / EC2 Location: REMOTE Salary: $100k - $125k To apply: If interested in the position, contact Jordyn Malmstrom at j.malmstromjeffersonfrank.com and send your updated resume attached in Word document format, or call me at (ext. 4413). My client is looking to fill the role as soon as possible. - provided by Dice

items.title: 100 % Remote Opportunity BMC Remedy System Engineer
items.content: Job Title: Sr. BMC Remedy Systems Engineer (Remote Opportunity) Location: Jacksonville, FL Duration: 6 Months Interview Type: telephonic skype NO C2C. Only W2 Candidates without sponsorship. (US Citizens, Green Card Holders) Job Description: Senior IT System Engineer- BMC Remedy Developer/Admin is responsible for monitoring, configuration, administration, troubleshooting and maintenance of the BMC Remedy Core Suite and other supporting BMC technologies. Provide technical support and troubleshoot problems and perform scripting/programming to ensure stable and efficient operation of technology solutions. Drive and implement automation enhancements and process improvement efforts, are assigned to multiple complex systems/applications. Lead initiatives, oversee work results, provide training and serve as a technical resource for other Systems Engineers. Essential Functions: Configures, and customizes software solutions using the BMC Remedy Action Request System (ARS) platform Configures, and customizes software solutions using the BMC Remedy IT Service Management ITSM Suite (IM, PM, AM, CM, SLA, CMDB, SRM & ADDM) Designs and provides software solutions in ARS ensuring the process flow of the Remedy ITSM modules renders expectations in SmartIT/MYIT (Digital Workplace) UI Experience with supporting the UI for the following BMC Products: Digital Workplace Advanced (DWPA), Smart IT, MY IT Leverages the software development lifecycle to design, build, test, and implement solutions based on customers requirements Assists in defining user requirements within the Remedy ITSM client applications Develop custom applications and workflows to support the automation of manual and resource intensive business processes Documents coding changes to be used for test and migration plans Troubleshoots software bugs using client and server logging Packages coding changes for releases to be migrated between the applicable environments, e.g., development, test and production Provides the Operations and Maintenance Team system support, as needed Performs standard administration system configuration Works as part of a Team on customer engagements May participate in Disaster Recovery planning and exercise Preferred Work Experience: 7 years related work experience or equivalent combination of transferable experience and education. Preferred Education: Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of experience and education Additional Required Qualifications: Demonstrated proficiency and experience in design, implementation, monitoring and troubleshooting technical infrastructure or development or equivalent combination of transferable experience and education Extensive working knowledge of multiple technologies and their interfaces and integration Creating and modifying objects using Developer Studio Competent working in one or more environments highly integrated with an operating system Experience with Data Migration Tool Experience with Spoon Experience implementing and administering/managing technical solutions in major, large-scale system implementations High critical thinking skills to evaluate alternatives and present solutions that are consistent with business objectives and strategy Ability to manage tasks independently and take ownership of responsibilities Ability to learn from mistakes and apply constructive feedback to improve performance Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing environment Proven leadership abilities including effective knowledge sharing, conflict resolution, facilitation of open discussions, fairness and displaying appropriate levels of assertiveness Ability to communicate highly complex technical information clearly and articulately for all levels and audiences Additional Preferred Qualifications: ITIL Foundations V3 BMC Certified AR System Developer 9.x or higher Working knowledge of Configuration Management Database (CMDB), Smart Reporting and Analytics Experience using Agile methodology Comments for Suppliers: 100% Remote Acceptable - provided by Dice

DevOps Engineer

Company: WorldCoders
Location: Lisbon, PT
Remote location: Partially remote
Requires Work Permit
Level: Intermediate
Language: English
DevOps / Sysadmin
Skills:
  • Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • Bash
  • Linux
  • Python

    • Intro

    You will be working for the preferred partner for corporations throughout Europe when it comes to implementing and providing maintenance for its customers’ new digital technologies. More than 40,000 service calls per day clearly make our client one of Europe’s leading organization in this market and prove, that if things need fixing, they’ll provide a solution. From telecommunications and IT to security & safety installations, smart building technologies and POS devices – its more than 8,000 service engineer will find solutions for new technologies. The company offers full service human and technical support to help its customers with new technologies, relying on its network of engineers around Europe for on-site interventions (installation and maintenance) and provides logistics and call center support with its back-office teams. 
     
    Our Team: 
     
    • Be a part of a dynamic team of experts practicing Scrum and utilizes transparent communication using Slack and Jira.
    • We build and manage the development, testing and production environment on AWS Cloud.
    • We develop internal build or deployment tools for automation processes.
    • Get the chance to work with PHP, Python developers and QA during the development and testing processes.
    • Recommend DevOps and AWS best practices for security, performance and cost optimizations.

    Main requirements

    Qualifications: 

     

    • Professional experience or at least 3 years’ experience with the following AWS services: EC2, RDS, Elasticache, EFS, Route 53, ELB or ALB, ECS, Redshift.
    • Strong scripting experience with proficiency in Python and BASH.
    • Experience in Linux administration.
    • Experience working with DevOps Tools and CI and CD (GitLabCI, CloudFormation, Docker/Compose, Selenium)
    • Experience using consolidated logging and monitoring tools such as Cloudwatch or New Relic.
    • Familiar with standard IT security practices such as encryption and certificates,
    • Skills in MySQL, PostgreSQL and Git.

    Nice to have

    • Good to have: 
      • AWS Certified Solutions Architect Associate or SysOps Administrator Associate. 


    Perks

    • A great workplace in the heart of booming Lisbon
    • Work on new features and functionality for great brands
    • Work on the quality of the code and a propriety framework
    • Great possibilities to learn and grow
    • Joining and help building our community of code fanatics
    • An excellent salary that matches your skills and experience
    • A really inspiring second home we call office with great colleagues and stuff

items.content:
Infrastructure Engineer (AWS, Remote Option)

We are seeking an Infrastructure or DevOps Engineer with experience of AWS and Infrastructure as Code tools to join a brand name web brand modernising their systems environment, scaling cloud and introducing DevOps methods and tooling.

The team offer a very flexible working environment with flexible remote working and hours with access to offices in London and Hertfordshire.

As the Infrastructure Engineer you will join an early stage Cloud and Ops team, supporting the scalability of AWS based platforms and introducing modern Infrastructure as Code (Terraform being used), CI processes and container tooling. The team have secured both substantial funding and senior stakeholder support for the Cloud and Ops transformation and you will have the opportunity to be a key influencer in its progression and success.

We are seeking an Infrastructure Engineer with;

  • Commercial Cloud experience within an AWS environment
  • Worked with Infrastructure as Code tooling, preferably Terraform within a production environment but open to experience
  • Broad Ops and systems experience which could include CI tooling, container technologies, server engineering or scripting for automation
  • A background in Microsoft/Windows environments would be beneficial but flexible


Infrastructure Engineer (AWS, Remote Option)

Salary: £45,000 - £55,000 plus Benefits, superb work/life balance

Location: Central London with part-remote/work from home option

items.content:
Site Reliability Engineer (AWS)

Remote, ideally located in the UTC -4 to -6 region 

 

Snowplow enables you to track any event data; ask any question of that data and use any tool you want to answer it. We want to empower people and companies to do transformative things using data. 

 

As a company, we have almost doubled in size over the last 18 months and we’re not looking to slow down. To support our growth, we are now looking for an SRE (Site Reliability Engineer) to join our Tech Ops Team. You’ll be taking the lead on all things AWS including development and improvements of the current stack and rolling out new features - all whilst keeping these environments running smoothly. We would love to hear from you if the idea of programmatically controlling thousands of production environments excites you!.

 

The Opportunity: 

Our Private SaaS offering has grown significantly over the past year and we now orchestrate and monitor Snowplow event pipelines across more than 150 customer-owned AWS & GCP sub-accounts.  Each account has its own individualised and optimised stack and all are capable of processing many billions of events per month.

 

We are looking for another SRE to help us grow to managing 1,000 and then 10,000 AWS, GCP & Azure accounts. You will be pioneering solutions to managing estates of this size through cutting edge monitoring and automation. You’ll work closely with our Tech Ops Lead on all aspects of our proprietary deployment, orchestration and monitoring stacks.

 

Tech Ops has two areas of responsibility: the centralised services we provide customers and their pipeline infrastructure hosted in their own AWS or GCP accounts.  Within both domains we are striving to increase service reliability, fulfil customer requests in a timely fashion, and automate recurring tasks.  Task automation is essential as our customer base grows, because our infrastructure estate scales linearly with our customer numbers, unlike most software businesses.

 

The challenge of automating the maintenance and deployment of thousands of individualised stacks is an enormously ambitious undertaking and a hugely exciting infrastructure automation challenge!

 

The environment you’ll be working in:

Our company values are Transparency, Honesty, Ownership, Inclusivity, Empowerment, Customer-centricity, Growth and Technical Excellence. These aren’t just words we plucked out of thin air, we came up with them together as a company and are continually looking to find new ways to weave these into our day to day operations. From flexible hours and working locations to the way we give feedback, we’re passionate about building a company that supports both company and individual development.

 

What you’ll be doing:

Maintaining and developing our growing Terraform infrastructure-as-code stacks which we use to deploy infrastructure for all internal and client use cases

Maintaining our internal infrastructure stacks which include the HashiCorp suite as well as our Snowplow Insights UI and VPNs

Participating in our on-call rotation to help us serve our client base 24/7

Taking rotations of L3 Technical Support where you will be responsible for triaging and dealing with infrastructure issues

Handling high-severity internal or customer incidents, ensuring we meet all SLAs

 

What you bring to the team:

Has worked with AWS in a production capacity - experience in GCP and/or Azure is a bonus

Has worked with Terraform, CloudFormation or some form of infrastructure-as-code tooling

Any experience with the HashiCorp stack (Vault, Consul, Nomad) and understanding their role in infrastructure automation is a bonus

Has worked with Docker and is familiar with container-based architectures

Knowledgeable about the Linux operating system and how to manage servers in a production capacity

Knowledgeable about Cloud networking principles and how to troubleshoot issues in this space

Comfortable scripting in one or more of: Bash, Python, Ruby or Perl

Comfortable programming in one or more of: Java, Scala, Golang or Python

 

What you’ll get in return

A competitive package based on experience, including share options

25 days of holiday a year (plus bank holidays)

MacBook or Dell XPS 13/15

Two fantastic company Away Weeks in a different European city each year (the last one was in May 2019 in Lisbon)

Work alongside a supportive and talented team with the opportunity to work on cutting edge technology and challenging problems

Grow and develop in a fast-moving, collaborative organisation

Enjoy fun events in and around London organised by our Cultural Work Committee

If based in London, convenient office location in central London (Shoreditch) and a continuous supply of Pact coffee and healthy snacks

 



Snowplow is dedicated to building and supporting a brilliant, diverse and hugely inclusive team. We don't discriminate against gender, race, religion or belief, disability, age, marital status or sexual orientation. Whatever your background may be, we welcome anyone with talent, drive and emotional intelligence.

About Snowplow Analytics

We have an office located in London but believe in letting our team members choose where they work best so nearly half of the company currently works remotely. We offer flexibility, trust and freedom.

We're looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to join our fully remote TechOps team.

Benefits

items.title: Product, Ops and Strategy Intern
tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
items.content:
Product, Ops & Strategy Intern


Flexy Health provides 24/7 AI-assisted support for preventing and managing behavioural conditions. Our first product is an intelligent assistant for what you eat, recommending recipes and food-to-go tailored to your location, goals, lifestyle, and budget.


We’re early stage and trying to establish product-market fit before raising a seed round in a few months, so it’s the perfect time to join if you’re looking for a challenge and a rare opportunity to join a UK healthtech startup in the early days.


You’ll work together with our Founder on some of our toughest challenges across product development and operations. You'll employ your experiences, creativity, and keen eye for detail alongside the Founder's experiences gained in startups, strategy consulting, and as a qualified personal trainer. Expect a style that's focused, very human, open to challenge, and down-to-earth.


Here’s what we’re expecting from you:



  • Are hyper-dependable when it comes to getting stuff done

  • Show flawless attention to detail

  • Understand how to manage your time and communicate progress and challenges - no bad surprises

  • Demonstrate a solid level of Google Sheets

  • Are quick to upskill with unfamiliar programmes (e.g., Airtable, Coda, Trello)

  • Show a deep interest in health and wellbeing


It’d also be great if you:



  • Have experience and interest in nutrition / nutritional science specifically

  • Have worked in another early stage startup / on your own idea, side hustle or business


Location:



  • Rocketspace (by Angel tube station) or remote possible


Working hours and pay:



  • 2 days per week, flexible on which days

  • Travel and lunch expenses plus £50 daily stipend

items.content:
An exciting EdTech company based in the DC metro area is hiring for a 100% remote Senior level DevOps/Operations engineer to manage their high availability cloud footprint. Their software/platform provides cutting edge, patent pending tools for teachers to impact students in the classroom. 40% of all teachers in the US are currently users of their product suite and they take impacting kids education very seriously. They have world leaders and foundations as their investors, and became profitable this year. This person will work with a talented team of software developers and QA to manage the AWS environment, build CI/CD pipelines, automate where possible and innovate where necessary. They are looking for an engineer capable of continuing their 99.8% up time track record while still finding ways of improving the environment. Therefore, they are looking for an engineer with extensive Linux experience who is great at problem solving and can think outside of the box. The ideal candidate would also have experience with scripting, automation and a good understanding of the cloud. Any docker or kubernetes is a major plus!

This is a Full-Time role, with competitive compensation and benefits which includes affordable healthcare, disability insurance, 401(k) match and training budget.

Required Skills & Experience

6+ years of Linux EngineeringExtensive AWS knowledgeAutomation (Chef, Salt, Ansible)scripting with Ruby on Rails or PythonKnowledge of Cloud technologies

Desired Skills & Experience

DockerKubernetes

What You Will Be Doing

Tech Breakdown

60% AWS40% Automation/Orchestration/CI/CD

Daily Responsibilities

100% Hands On

The Offer

Competitive Salary: Up to $160K/year, DOE

You will receive the following benefits:

Health, Vision, & Dental InsuranceFlexible Spending Accounts401(k)PTO & Holidays Offstock options

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis now and in the future.

This position does not offer sponsorship.

Jobspring Partners, part of the Motion Recruitment network, provides IT Staffing Solutions (Contract, Contract-to-Hire, and Direct Hire) across 10 major North American markets. Our unique expertise in today's highest demand tech skill sets, paired with our deep networks and knowledge of our local technology markets, results in an exemplary track record with candidates and clients.

items.title: DevOps Engineer | Artificial Intelligence Start-Up | Remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=8, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=6, ruby=2, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
AWS DevOps Engineer | San Diego | Artificial Intelligence Start-Up


Our client in the AI start-up space is looking for a DevOps engineer with experience in Configuration Management and CI/CD tools such as Puppet, Chef, or Jenkins. In this role, you'll be working closely with the Product Development team to build, deploy, and support custom services. You'll be responsible for tier-II/III support and escalation of a highly-available Production environment, as well as provide technical leadership.

You will work with other team members to build and maintain highly available, high performance, and scalable systems. You will take part in maintaining and improving our deployment and scaling process. You will work with Development and DevOps teams on automation of infrastructure processes. You will work closely with the Developers to ensure efficiency on product releases. You will participate in creating and improving our security policies and procedures that will ensure the protection of customer and corporate data. You will work with other team members or independently to troubleshoot issues that arise with the application and escalate to software engineering when necessary. You are expected to assist other team members on system and infrastructure-related issues when necessary. You will participate in on-call rotation.


What you'll be doing:



  • Designs, develops, documents, tests, and debugs new and existing Ruby configuration management (Chef and Terraform) infrastructure as code.
  • Contributes to requirements analysis and design.
  • Provides critical input in design meetings and analyzes user needs to determine technical requirements

Desired Skills:



  • DevOps or Network/System Engineering experience.
  • Working knowledge of Golang, Bash or Python
  • Experience or knowledge of technologies such as Docker, Terraform, Cloud Formation.
  • Working with the cloud platform (AWS/GCP)
  • Strong NoSQL or PostgreSQL experience

Please see for more fantastic AWS opportunities.


To be considered for this role, please apply directly to this advertisement or call me at or email me at .


Jefferson Frank is the global leader for Amazon Web Services recruitment, advertising more AWS roles than any other agency. We deal with both AWS Partners & End Users throughout North America. By specializing solely in placing candidates in the AWS market we have built relationships with most of the key employers in North America and have a complete understanding of where the best opportunities and AWS jobs are.


Jefferson Frank is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

- provided by Dice
